title: Grievious Wounds
body: Can we have old Grievious Wounds back? healers are a pain to deal with :(

replies.body: Right now we're looking at whether we should revert Grievous Wounds to its old functionality as part of the mid-season patch. Our original hope was that making healing output more consistent for extremely healing focused champions would make them easier to balance. That hasn't worked as well as desired however. As a result we're testing going back to GW affecting all healing to restore the partial safety valve that old GW gave when champs that heal others got out of line.
What happened to the old 'get rid of Grevious Wounds altogether' idea? It's a really binary mechanic that is completely necessary against some champs and completely useless against others.

GW as a safety valve is something we're still interested in. Generally there's something you can do to specifically improve your effectiveness when a specific enemy champion is doing really well. Against a melee auto attacker for example Frozen Heart's disproportionately valuable, Banshee's is especially strong against single CC focused champs like Blitz or Annie, Mikael's is great against Morg or Ashe etc. Grevious Wounds offers such an effect against champions whose power increases in self or ally focused ways (e.g. the unkillable Mundo or, if going back to an all healing model, the constantly topping people off Soraka).

If you do decide to go back to the old GW paradigm, does that mean you'll revert a lot of the nerfs you've handed Soraka over the past 6 months? Many of these nerfs were because her healing wasn't affected by GW. And as such, if GW goes back to it's old form, Soraka will have been thoroughly dumpstered.

Soraka will desperately need her Q sustain ramped up, her W's heal back up, and her Ult getting it's ability to remove GW back. Hell, could you just roll Soraka back to how she was in 5.20?

This is Riot we're talking about, they never buff a champion after gutting them over a certain mechanic or item, even if those things return to a normal state. Meanwhile the affected champion remains in the dumpster. They've done this countless times already.

This is exactly right. She's been nerfed so many times because they changed GW. Her mana costs are way higher now & heal does way less healing now as a result of the nerfs to deal with GW being changed. Now, before the GW change (and thus before her nerfs) she was fine. So if they revert the GW change but they don't revert the numerous nerfs she's gotten she will be completely useless and that's not acceptable either.
Soraka was not in the dumpster before the GW changes. She was still good, just not AS good as now.
Yes, and you can build resists or use shields to mitigate damage.  The only thing you can do to mitigate heals are do more damage or apply grievous wounds.
GW doesn't have 100% uptime. It falls off, what are you talking about?
For Morello's you have to be below 40%. Hardly anyone buys Mortal Reminder (because it sucks, even against Mundo) but the counterplay is to not get hit. Just walk away.

GW is still useful vs Swain, Vlad, Aatrox, Volibear, and Warwick. It's not something that should go away. The old GW was fine. Because Nami, Sona, Soraka, and to a different extent Janna have good sustain and need something to be curbed.

Direct item counters matter little, as plenty do that already. See: Mercurial Scimitar, Banshee's Veil, and Zhonya's.

Today I played Mundo top and my opponent chose Quinn and bought first item Executioner's Calling. It felt pretty effective, though it didn't let her just out right kill me or anything it certainly changed how I played. I couldn't just all in her easily, relying on my ult to win the fight, so I had to try to wear her down. But that didn't work well because she could kite me and mostly avoid cleavers by staying behind minions.

To me the item felt overall effective and worth while for her without making me feel completely useless on Mundo, especially once I got to do stuff away from her. I think a lot of the problem with the item comes from its lack of build path options, not due to it failing to do its job. I almost never buy it when I ADC in part because it only builds into one thing and I often still want the effect from Giant Slayer as well. I really wish GS + EC combined into something.

All I'm hearing here is "In the preseason, we made Soraka fun to play. We want her to go back to not being fun to play."  I've always played healer type champs in games (e.g. holy priests in World of Warcraft).  This season was the first time we had a character who was a genuine combat medic (as opposed to say Nami or Sona whose heals are mostly about lane sustain).  I love looking at the stat screen after a game and seeing my healing numbers matching up well with the damage dealt to champs by other characters.  That's not broken.  That's a new and fun way to play the game.  Meanwhile, Soraka is squishy enough, lacks hard cc (unless the E manages to proc), and has to get close enough to her targets that she can be vulnerable to assassins or other characters who want to get at her.  Why reintroduce a mechanic that can completely shut her down with the purchase of one already good item?  (Morellonomicon and/or Mortal Reminder).  You might as well just kiss Soraka goodbye.  Right now, enemies have to take a risk to try to get at Soraka using tactics.  Reintroducing GW as you're suggesting means that a team just needs one AOE heavy mage with Morellonomicon and Soraka can be efffectively shut down from a safe distance with no way available for her to counter it.
